definition[0]: probably not honest, true, right etc
example[0]: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
example[1]: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
example[2]: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious.
definition[1]: not sure whether something is good or true
example[3]: I can see you are dubious; take some time to think about it.
example[4]: ‘Are you sure you know what you are doing?’ Andy said, looking dubious.
example[5]: Some universities are dubious about accepting students over the age of 30.
definition[2]: not good or not of good quality
example[6]: The room was decorated in dubious taste.
